bugs.title: Cacti 1.2.16 is not available for EPEL7

bugzilla.short_desc: Cacti 1.2.16 is not available for EPEL7

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Cacti 1.2.16 is not available for EPEL7

Additional info:

I checked cacti.net to see that there was an update for Cacti, but it's not available in EPEL7.  I checked Koji and confirmed that it was built for EPEL8 and Fedora versions. https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=1436

I can't see anything to indicate why EPEL7 might be incompatible, and EL7 is not yet EOL.
FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-14424 cacti: lack of escaping on template import can lead to XSS [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-14424 cacti: lack of escaping on template import can lead to XSS [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-14424 cacti: lack of escaping on template import can lead to XSS

long_desc.thetext:
Lack of escaping on template import can lead to XSS exposure under 'midwinter' theme.

Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/pull/4261

Created cacti tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2001018]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2001017]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2001016,2001018

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899
FEDORA-EPEL-2021-242bfc4463 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-242bfc4463

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-242bfc4463 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 8 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-242bfc4463

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-242bfc4463 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 8 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-EPEL-2021-8f1a739899 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
